qas.question: What leader started a mass movement against British rule?
What means did Gandhi espouse to gain self-rule?
What group wanted to use violent means to over throw the British rule?
On what date did India gain its independence?
What action did the movements combine to produce?

context: From 1920 leaders such as <a0_0>Mahatma Gandhi<a0_0/> began highly popular mass movements to campaign against the British Raj using largely <a1_0>peaceful<a1_0/> methods. The Gandhi-led independence movement opposed the British rule using non-violent methods like non-cooperation, civil disobedience and economic resistance. However, revolutionary activities against the British rule took place throughout the Indian subcontinent and some others adopted a militant approach like the <a2_0>Indian National Army<a2_0/> that sought to overthrow British rule by armed struggle. The <a4_0>Government of India Act 1935<a4_0/> was a major success in this regard. All these movements succeeded in bringing independence to the new dominions of India and Pakistan on <a3_0>15 August 1947<a3_0/>.
